User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101130 Firefox/3.5.16
Build Identifier: 3.1.7

In Outlook Express, I could depress the middle wheel of my mouse, a scroll symbol would appear, and depending on the distance of the mouse cursor from that scroll symbol (or something like that, it has been awhile), the message list window would scroll at a varying rate.  I have not been able to make that work with Thunderbird, and I've had Thunderbird versions 2 and 3.  In mozillazine, topic "depressed center wheel on mouse scrolling", Rod Whiteley indicates that this may be a design limitation with lists.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Go to message list, ie. that folder is in a tab and the message list shows.
2.  Press middle scroll wheel on mouse.
3.  In v3.1.7, the highlighted line moved to where the cursor is, and that message is put in its own tab.  Not what I want.
Actual Results:  
In v3.1.7, the highlighted line moved to where the cursor is, and that message is put in its own tab.

Expected Results:  
I would like to see the scroll symbol appear as in OE, and scrolling to commence depending on the position of the mouse.

Instead I have to roll the mouse wheel repeatedly with my finger to scroll.  Wears out the finger.
